partners: Sellers, suppliers, shipping carriers, AWS clients
valueProposition: Customers can find and purchase a wide variety of products quickly and easily, while sellers gain access to a massive customer base
customerRelationships: Customer support, personalized recommendations, self-service tools
channels: Website, mobile app, Alexa voice assistant
customerSegments: Online shoppers, sellers, businesses, and developers
structure: E-commerce platform, fulfillment centers, data centers, delivery network
revenueStreams: Product sales, subscription fees, advertising, cloud computing services
problem: Finding and purchasing a wide range of products quickly and easily
solution: A user-friendly online marketplace that offers an extensive selection of products and efficient delivery
keyMetrics: Revenue, active customers, seller growth, Prime memberships, AWS usage
uniqueSellingProposition: A vast product selection, fast shipping, and competitive pricing
highLevelConcept: An online marketplace that makes buying and selling products simple and convenient
unfairAdvantage: Extensive logistics network, brand recognition, and data-driven personalization
earlyAdopters: Online shoppers looking for convenience, variety, and competitive prices
mobileAdvantages: Shopping on the go, notifications, and easy access to customer support
microphone: Voice shopping and search using Alexa
appIntegrations: Amazon Prime Video, Music, Kindle, and Alexa
location: Personalized recommendations based on location and delivery preferences
offline: Amazon Go stores, Amazon Books, Whole Foods Market
appSavings: Amazon Prime member discounts and deals
inAppPayments: One-click purchasing and secure payment processing
peopleAndRoles: Jeff Bezos as founder and visionary, AWS team for cloud computing, fulfillment center employees
commonGoals: Creating the world's most customer-centric company
personalGoals: Making it easier for customers to buy and sell products online
purpose: To be Earth's most customer-centric company
values: Customer obsession, long-term thinking, innovation, and operational excellence
needsAndExpectations: Efficient logistics, seamless user experience, and continuous innovation
rulesAndActivities: Invest in infrastructure, data-driven decision-making, and constantly improve customer experience
strengthsAndAssets: Extensive product selection, fast shipping, competitive pricing, and customer focus
weaknessesAndRisks: Dependency on online retail, potential regulatory scrutiny, and supply chain disruptions
buyerPersona: Individuals and businesses looking for a convenient way to purchase a wide variety of products
buyerGoals: Finding desired products at competitive prices with fast and reliable shipping
buyerInitiatives: Using personalized recommendations, promotions, and search features to discover new products
buyingProcess: Browsing, searching, adding to cart, and completing purchase through the website or mobile app
buyTiming: Year-round shopping, especially during promotions and holiday seasons, such as Black Friday, Cyber Monday, Prime Day, and Christmas
buyerThinking: Customers seek a convenient, reliable, and user-friendly shopping
buyerChannels: Online marketplace, mobile app, voice-activated shopping through Alexa-enabled devices
whyBuy: Convenience, extensive product selection, competitive prices, and fast shipping
buyerInfluencers: Product reviews, ratings, and recommendations from friends and family
buyerContent: Customers engage with product listings, reviews, and personalized recommendations on the website and app
strengths: Extensive logistics network, customer-centric approach, and data-driven personalization
opportunities: Expansion into new markets, growth of Amazon Web Services (AWS), and development of new services
weaknesses: Potential regulatory scrutiny, dependency on online retail, and supply chain disruptions
threats: Competitors like Walmart, Alibaba, and eBay, as well as emerging e-commerce platforms and technology disruptions
productsAndServices: Amazon.com marketplace, Amazon Prime, AWS, Alexa, Kindle, Amazon Go, Amazon Fresh, and Whole Foods Market
gainCreators: Providing a one-stop-shop for customers, offering fast shipping, and enhancing the overall shopping experience
painRelievers: Streamlining the purchasing process, offering customer support, and addressing delivery issues promptly
gains: Customers benefit from the convenience, variety, and competitive prices offered by Amazon
pains: Customers may experience information overload or difficulty finding specific products amid the vast selection
customerJobs: Customers need a convenient and reliable way to purchase a wide range of products online
